solution_line_template: First find how many ml of water Jason needs for 1 gram of charcoal: {water_per_unit} ml / {charcoal_per_unit} grams = <<{water_per_unit}/{charcoal_per_unit}={ml_per_gram}>>{ml_per_gram} ml/g

Then divide the amount of water Jason uses by the amount of water per gram of charcoal to find how much charcoal he uses: {total_water} ml / {ml_per_gram} ml/g = <<{total_water}/{ml_per_gram}={charcoal_used}>>{charcoal_used} g
